title: Transaction Illustration
contentTitle: STOCK INDEX, GOLD & SILVER LOCO LONDON TRANSACTIONS
formulaText: [ ( Selling Price – Buying Price ) x Contract Size x n Lot ] – [ ( Facility Fee + VAT ) x n Lot ]
keteranganLines: Contract Size (contract value): US $5 per point for stock index rolling contracts, 100 troy ounces for Loco London gold daily rolling, and 100,000 for forex daily rolling spot.
n Lot: number of lots being traded.
Facility Fee (commission): US $15 per lot per side (buy or sell).
Total commission fee is US $30 for 1 lot settlement.
VAT (Value Added Tax): 11% of commission fee, i.e. US $1.65/lot/side.
Total VAT is US $3.3 for 1 lot settlement.
If the transaction is settled more than one day (overnight), a roll-over fee applies for each lot (see trading table).

ex1.title: Example 1 (HKK5U_BBJ)
ex1.p1: An investor buys HKK5U_BBJ at 18,000 for 2 lots (Open Buy 2 lots), expecting price to rise. During the day session price rises to 18,400 and they close all positions at 18,300 (Closed Sell 2 lots).

ex2.title: Example 2 (JPK5U_BBJ)
ex2.p1: An investor anticipates a decline in JPK5U_BBJ and sells at 14,850 for 2 lots. Two days later they close at 14,650.
ex2.f1: P/L = [(Selling Price - Buying Price) x Contract Size x n Lot] - [(Fee US$30 + VAT) x n Lot]
ex2.f3: P/L = (200 points x $ 5 x 2 lots) - (US$ 33 x 2 lots) = US$2,000 - US$66.6
ex2.result: Overnight fee US$8 (US$2 x 2 lots x 2 nights). Net profit = US$1,933.4 - US$8 = US$1,925.4

ex3.title: Example 3 (XULF)
ex3.p1: An investor predicts a positive trend in Loco London gold and plans to buy. They buy 2 lots at $1,175.30/oz. Price falls to $1,160.65/oz and they close 1 lot at $1,165.30/oz. The next day they close the remaining lot at $1,190.20/oz.
ex3.d1f1: P/L = [US$(1165.30 - 1175.30) / troy ounce x 100 troy ounces x 1 lot] - [US$(30 + 3.3) x 1 lot]
ex3.d2f1: P/L = [US$(1190.20 to 1175.30) / troy ounce x 100 x 1 lot] - [US$ (30 + 3.3) x 1 lot]
ex3.rollover: Since held more than 1 day, roll over fee: US$5 x 1 lot x 1 night = US$5

ex4.title: Example 4 (XAGF)
ex4.p1: An investor expects Loco London silver price to rise, buys XAGF at $24.175/oz for 1 lot, and closes at $24.200.
ex4.f1: P/L = [ ( Selling Price – Buying Price ) x Contract Size x n Lot ] - [ ( Facility Fee + VAT ) x n Lot ]
ex4.f2: P/L = [ ( US $ 24,200 / troy ounce – US $ 24,175 / troy ounce ) x 100 troy ounces x 1 lot ] – [ ( US $ 30 + US $ 3.3 ) x 1 lot ]
ex4.f3: P/L = ( 0.025 / troy ounce x 5,000 / troy ounce x 1 lot ) – ( US $ 33.3 )
ex4.af1: P/L = [ ( Selling Price – Buying Price ) x Contract Size x n Lot ] - [ ( Facility Fee + VAT ) x n Lot ]
ex4.af2: P/L = [ ( US $ 24,155 / troy ounce – US $ 24,175 / troy ounce ) x 5,000 troy ounces x 1 lot ] – [ ( US $ 30 + US $ 3.3 ) x 1 lot ]
ex4.af3: P/L = ( - 0.020 / troy ounce x 5,000 / troy ounce x 1 lot ) – ( US $ 33.3 )

forex.directFormula: P / L = [ ( Selling Price – Buying Price ) x Contract Size x n Lot ] – [ ( Facility Fee + VAT ) x n Lot ]
forex.indirectFormula: P / L = (Selling Price - Purchase Price) / Liquidation Price x Contract Size x Number of Lots

ex1.p1: Investor predicts EUR/USD will rise, buys 2 lots at 1.3530 and later closes at 1.3540 (clear position).
ex1.f1: P/L = [ ( Selling Price – Buying Price ) x Contract Size x n Lot ] – [ ( Facility Fee + VAT ) x n Lot ]
ex1.result: Net profit: Rp 1,334,000.00 (fixed rate US$1 = Rp 10,000.00)

ex2.title: Example 2: UJ1010_BBJ (Daytrade)
ex2.p1: Investor predicts USD/JPY will fall, sells 1 lot at 102.20 then closes at 102.12.
ex2.result: P/L = US$45.04 — Profit Rp 450,400.00 (fixed rate US$1 = Rp 10,000.00)
ex2.altHeading: If price goes to 102.27 and is closed at the same level:
ex2.altResult: Net loss: Rp 1,017,400.00 (fixed rate US$1 = Rp 10,000.00)
